intro: Schaetzellia standleyi, commonly known as the Mexican sunflower, is a species of flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its vibrant yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardeners seeking bright, showy blooms. Its ornamental value is further enhanced by its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
